correspAction.name: the Gardeners' Improvement Society of South Australia

head.supplied: [Baron F. von Müeller, of Melbourne, Government Botanist, wrote, acknowledging and accepting the hon. membership conferred upon him a short time ago, ¶ The date of conferring has not been established,...

div.p: To the Gardeners' Improvement Society of South Australia

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: Letter not found. The text given here is from a report of the meeting of the Gardeners' Improvement Society held on 5 June 1880, Evening journal (Adelaide), 7 June 1880, p. 3.

p.seg: [Baron F. von Müeller, of Melbourne, Government Botanist, wrote, acknowledging and accepting the hon. membership conferred upon him a short time ago,

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

note.p: The date of conferring has not been established, nor has a letter announcing it been found. In a report of the Society's meeting published in South Australian chronicle and weekly mail, 12 June 1880, p. 23, M is reported as thanking the society for electing him an 'honorary corresponding member'.

p.seg: and forwarded a donation of books to the library, comprising three decades of his "Eucalyptographia,"

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; margin-left: 0.3346in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.3346in; font-size: 9pt;

p.seg: and others, and promised to send some others at a future time.]
